CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 1, 1954, pg. 21, reads: "NAACP MEMBERSHIP DRIVE OPENS - The 1954 membership campaign of the Pittsburgh Branch of the NAACP opened Sunday at a meeting at Wesley Center AME Zion Church. At the left, veteran campaign workers prepare to enroll 7,500 members. They include, left to right, John G. Jones, Mrs. Carrie Phillips, Rufus Smith, national staff member who is assisting the local drive; Mrs. Lelia Hill and James Anderson ... - Harris Photos."
TitMainTitle: John G. Jones, Carrie Phillips, Rufus Smith, Lelia Hill, and James Anderson gathered in Wesley Center AME Zion Church for NAACP membership drive
